newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling edges up vs dlr on export inflows.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling edges up vs dlr on export inflows.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling edged up marginally against the dollar on Tuesday amid modest inflows from the agricultural sector, commercial bank dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted a shilling mean rate of 54.93 against the dollar from 54.94 on Monday. Against the pound it was posted at a mean rate of 87.97 from 88.20.
The dollar inflows were from the traditional tea and coffee weekly auctions.
"The shilling is still range-bound at 54.88/98 but because of good amounts business is brisk today," a dealer said.
For the last three weeks the shilling has been stable in range-bound trading. Dealers said in the absence of any fresh factors the market was likely to remain stable.
The money market was liquid with overnight rates quoted between 10-15 percent unchanged.
